intro: Peristrophe purpurea, commonly known as purple peristrophe, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are clustered in whorls and bloom during the summer months. Peristrophe purpurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
